name: Chocolate-Peppermint Skillet Cookie
author: FOODBEAST
summary: This egg-free chocolate skillet cookie topped with crushed candy canes and a sugary glaze requires no rolling or scooping--it bakes up in a skillet into a giant cookie you can share with friends. Top it with ice cream, if desired.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon vegan butter, or to taste
7 tablespoons unsweetened chocolate-flavored almond milk (such as Blue Diamond® Almond Breeze®)
1 tablespoon unsweetened chocolate-flavored almond milk (such as Blue Diamond® Almond Breeze®)
1  peppermint candy cane, crushed, or more to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Grease an 8-inch cast iron skillet with vegan butter
Sift flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt into a medium bowl
Combine white sugar, brown sugar, and softened vegan butter in a large bowl
Add dry ingredients and mix until thoroughly combined
Fold in 1/2 of the chocolate chunks
Transfer 2/3 of the dough to the prepared skillet and press it evenly into the bottom
Cover with remaining dough, flattening it evenly over the top
Bake in the preheated oven for exactly 10 minutes
While the cookie is baking, combine powdered sugar and almond milk in a large mixing bowl
Whisk icing to a drizzling consistency
Remove cookie from the oven and cool slightly
Drizzle icing with a spoon over top of the cookie and top with crushed candy cane
